articles.title: President Kim Il Sung's Works Published in Peru
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung's Works Published in Peru 
    Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) --President Kim Il Sung's famous works "On the Three Principles of National Reunification" and "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country" were published in booklet each on April 5 by the Publilaser Publishing House of Peru.
 The work "On the Three Principles of National Reunification", published in Juche 61 (1972), comprehensively clarifies the three principles that call for achieving national reunification independently and peacefully on the principle of promoting the great national unity free from outside interference and the orientation and ways for the north and the south to cooperate with each other in all fields of politics, economy and culture.    
 The work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country", published on April 6, Juche 82 (1993), elucidates all issues to be settled by the whole nation to achieve unity to found an independent, peaceful and neutral unified state.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Admit Its Legal Responsibility for Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Admit Its Legal Responsibility for Its Past Crimes 
    Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegate in a speech made during the debate on the agenda item 12 (women's rights) at the 60th Meeting of the UN Commission on Human Rights on April 5 strongly demanded Japan admit its legal responsibility for its past crimes, make an apology for them, make a state compensation for them and conduct a proper education in history. Japan has done nothing to liquidate its past crimes including the crimes related to the "comfort women" for the Japanese army, the delegate noted, and continued:
 Japan took away and abducted 200,000 women and forced them into state-sponsored sexual slavery for the army. Yet it is only Japan that does not regard it as a crime. On the contrary it is justifying the crimes, far from admitting its responsibility for them.    
 Japan's refusal to admit its legal responsibility for the crimes and its efforts to go without making a sincere apology and state compensation to the victims are another form of violation and insult to the honor, dignity and rights of the victims, the delegate said, requesting the special rapporteur on violence against women to pay attention to the root cause of the delay in redeeming the crimes related to the "comfort women" for the Japanese army and its consequences and strictly supervise the adherence to and implementation of the already established international norms and the recommendations made so far.

articles.title: Large Floral Basket Presented to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Large Floral Basket Presented to DPRK Embassy 
    Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihanouk sent a large floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh on April 8 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 Written on the ribbon of the floral basket were letters "Highest Tribute and Glory to the Great Leader Generalissimo H.E. Kim Il Sung. Norodom Sihanouk, King of Cambodia."

Congratulations to Algerian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Algerian President 
    Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on April 10 sent a congratulatory message to Abdelaziz Bouteflika on his reelection as president of Algeria.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Algeria would grow stronger and develop in the future, the message wholeheartedly wished him greater success in his responsible work for the stability and development of his country.

Congratulatory Message to Azerbaijani Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Azerbaijani Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Elmar Mameziyarov upon his appointment as foreign minister of the Azerbaijan Republic.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Azerbaijan would continue to develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples, the message hoped for a success in his responsible work.

Field Mobile Exercise to Be Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Field Mobile Exercise to Be Staged in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean army announced that it would start a field mobile exercise between Kimpho and the Han River from 9 p.m. on April 9, according to the south Korean KBS.
 Helicopters will fly and blank shells be fired during the exercise, it reported.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of O Ki Chun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of O Ki Chun
    Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of O Ki Chun, former director of the Photo Service Department of Rodong Sinmun, on April 9 expressing deep condolences over his death.
